text.error: Start date should be before end date

disclaimer.para1: The designations employed and the presentation of the material in this toolkit do not imply the expression of any opinion whatsoever on the part of WHO concerning the legal status of any country, territory, city or area or of its authorities, or concerning the delimitation of its frontiers or boundaries. Dotted and dashed lines on maps represent approximate border lines for which there may not yet be full agreement.
disclaimer.para2: The international borders of the map provided reflect the current political and geographic status as of the date of publication. However, the technical health information is based on data accurate with respect to the year selected. The disconnect in this arrangement should be noted but no implications regarding political or terminological status should be drawn from this arrangement as it is purely a function of technical and graphical limitations.

disclaimers.nodefault: There are no data for this combination of date, indicator and/or dimension of inequality. Change the selection to view available data.
disclaimers.nomap: There is either no data for this combination of variables or there are no boundaries of subnational regions that match those in the data. Maps are only available for Demographic and Health Survey (DHS) data.
disclaimers.nodeterminant: There are no data for this combination of variables. Change the selection to view available data.
disclaimers.nomapdataset: There are no maps associated with this dataset.
disclaimers.compareineq: By default, settings from the same income group and WHO region as the selected setting are shown, if data are available.
disclaimers.disclaimer: Please note that these data are from externally published sources and are therefore not WHO official estimates. Please refer to the Indicator Metadata in the About menu for more information.

titles.comparesumm: [indicator_name]: setting average and within-setting inequality (according to [dimension]) in [number_settings] settings

warnings.available: Estimates are displayed when data are available for the selected combination of variables; if estimates are not shown, data are not available or not reported because of small sample sizes.
warnings.availablemap: Estimates are displayed when data for the selected combination of variables and boundaries of subnational regions that match those in the data are available; if estimates are not shown, either data or boundaries are not available. Maps are only available for Demographic and Health Survey (DHS) data.
warnings.availabledeterminants: Estimates are displayed when data are available for the selected combination of variables.
warnings.axismin: Axis minimum must be greater than 0 for log-scale axis
warnings.verticalaxismin: Vertical axis minimum must be greater than 0 for log-scale axis

text.graph: The graph will be downloaded as a png or jpg image or pdf. Titles and axis labels will be displayed according to your selections.
text.map: The graph will be downloaded as a png or jpg image or pdf. Titles will be displayed according to your selections.
text.data: The data will be downloaded as a text file with values separated by commas or tabs, according to your selection. These can be opened in a text editor or spreadsheet package.
text.heat1: Health Equity Assessment Toolkit (HEAT): Software for exploring and comparing health inequalities in countries and territories. Built-in database edition. Version 6.0. Geneva, World Health Organization, 2024.
text.heat2: The data used in this version were drawn from the WHO Health Inequality Monitor data repository (2023 update) which may have been revised or updated since that time. The most recent version of that database is available on the WHO website (https://www.who.int/data/inequality-monitor/data).
text.disclaimer1: The designations employed and the presentation of the material in this toolkit do not imply the expression of any opinion whatsoever on the part of WHO concerning the legal status of any country, territory, city or area or of its authorities, or concerning the delimitation of its frontiers or boundaries. Dotted and dashed lines on maps represent approximate border lines for which there may not yet be full agreement.
text.disclaimer2: The international borders of the map provided reflect the current political and geographic status as of the date of publication. However, the technical health information is based on data accurate with respect to the year selected. The disconnect in this arrangement should be noted but no implications regarding political or terminological status should be drawn from this arrangement as it is purely a function of technical and graphical limitations.
text.heatplus1: Health Equity Assessment Toolkit Plus (HEAT Plus): Software for exploring and comparing health inequalities in countries. Upload database edition. Version 6.0. Geneva, World Health Organization, 2024.
text.heatplus2: WHO provides this toolkit without data, and all data added to, or resulting from, the toolkit are the sole responsibility of the user, not WHO.

citations.heat1: Suggested citation: Health Equity Assessment Toolkit (HEAT): Software for exploring and comparing health inequalities in countries. Built-in database edition. Version 6.0. Geneva: WHO, 2024.
citations.heatplus1: Suggested citation: Health Equity Assessment Toolkit Plus (HEAT Plus): Software for exploring and comparing health inequalities in countries. Upload database edition. Version 6.0. Geneva: WHO, 2024.
citations.heatplus2: WHO provides this toolkit without data, and all data added to, or resulting from, the toolkit are the sole responsibility of the user, not WHO.

paragraphs.heat1: This built-in database edition of the HEAT software uses data from the WHO Health Inequality Data Repository (2023 update).
paragraphs.heat2: HEAT enables the interactive exploration and comparison of health inequalities in countries and territories.
paragraphs.heat3c: in one setting of interest to determine the latest situation of inequality and the change in inequality over time.
paragraphs.heat4: Health inequality data, including disaggregated data and summary measures, are visualized in a variety of interactive graphs, maps and tables.
paragraphs.heat5c: in one setting of interest with the situation in other settings and do benchmarking.
paragraphs.heat6: Customized results can be exported and saved in different formats.
paragraphs.heat7: Measuring and monitoring health inequalities is crucial to identify differences in health between different population subgroups, providing important evidence for policies, programmes and practices that aim to tackle health inequities and achieve health for all.
paragraphs.heat8: The Health Equity Assessment Toolkit facilitates the analysis and reporting of health inequality data. Disaggregated data and summary measures are visualised in a variety of interactive ways. Customized results can be exported and used to inform priority-setting and policy-making.
paragraphs.heat9a: The built-in database edition of the software (HEAT) uses data from the
paragraphs.heat10a: The upload database edition of the software (HEAT Plus) is available on the
paragraphs.heat11a: For more information about the World Health Organization’s work on health inequality monitoring, please visit the
paragraphs.heatplus1: HEAT Plus enables the interactive exploration and comparison of health inequalities, using uploaded datasets.
paragraphs.heatplus2c: in one setting of interest to determine the latest situation of inequality and the change in inequality over time
paragraphs.heatplus3: Health inequality data, including disaggregated data and summary measures, are visualized in a variety of interactive graphs and tables.
paragraphs.heatplus4c: in one setting of interest with the situation in other settings and do benchmarking.
paragraphs.heatplus5: Customized results can be exported and saved in different formats.
paragraphs.heatplus6: Measuring and monitoring health inequalities is crucial to identify differences in health between different population subgroups, providing important evidence for policies, programmes and practices that aim to tackle health inequities and achieve health for all.
paragraphs.heatplus7: The Health Equity Assessment Toolkit Plus facilitates the analysis and reporting of health inequality data. Disaggregated data and summary measures are visualized in a variety of interactive ways. Customized results can be exported and used to inform priority-setting and policy-making.
paragraphs.heatplus8a: The built-in database edition of the software (HEAT) is available on the
paragraphs.heatplus9a: For more information about the World Health Organization’s work on health inequality monitoring, please visit the

labels.disclaimer: Datasets have to be in a specific format and stored as comma separated values (csv) or Microsoft Excel (xls or xlsx) files in order to be uploaded to HEAT Plus. The HEAT Plus template and validation tool helps you prepare your data according to the template and validate that your dataset has been formatted correctly. Please refer to the user manual for further information.

uploads.note: Please wait while your data are uploaded. The processing time will depend on the size of your database and the number of strata.

warnings.variables: The file does not have all the required variables
warnings.mandatory: One of the mandatory variables has missing values
warnings.notmandatory: There are missing values in the estimate variable. While not mandatory, if data for this variable are missing some calculations will not function in HEAT Plus.
warnings.characters: Not all character variables contain characters (text/string)
warnings.iso3: Not all ISO3 values are three characters
warnings.numbers: Variables that should be only numbers contain characters (text/string)
warnings.years: Not all years are four-digit numbers
warnings.integers: There are decimal numbers where integers are required
warnings.negatives: There are negative numbers where negative numbers are not allowed
warnings.positives: Variables that must be positive or missing are negative
warnings.binary: Variables that must be binary have non 1/0 values
warnings.orderedvars: There is a problem with the ordered variables
warnings.sequence: Subgroup order must be an increasing sequence of integers starting with 1 when ordered dimension = 1
warnings.settings: Setting and ISO3 are not consistent
warnings.abbreviations: Indicator abbreviation and name are not uniquely matched
warnings.ordereddims: There is inconsistency in ordered dimensions

blurb.rep_sdg_blurb: Sustainable Development Goal (SDG) indicators disaggregated by age, city, disability status, economic status, education, migratory status, place of residence and sex. (Original data source: UN Statistics SDG Indicators Database; updated 03/2023).
blurb.rep_gho_blurb: WHO health indicator estimates from the Global Health Observatory (GHO) disaggregated by age, economic status, place of residence and sex. (Original data source: WHO Global Health Observatory; updated 03/2023).
blurb.rep_ctis3_blurb: COVID-19 related indicators in the areas of disease burden, behaviours, beliefs and testing disaggregated by age, education, gender, health worker status and place of residence. (Original data source: University of Maryland Global COVID-19 Trends and Impact Survey (UMD-CTIS), in partnership with Facebook; updated 03/2022).
blurb.rep_ctis2_blurb: Indicators related to COVID-19 vaccination disaggregated by age, education, gender, health worker status and place of residence. (Original data source: University of Maryland Global COVID-19 Trends and Impact Survey (UMD-CTIS), in partnership with Facebook; updated 03/2022).
blurb.rep_ctis1_blurb: COVID-19 related indicators in the areas of mental health and financial worry disaggregated by age, education, gender, health worker status and place of residence. (Original data source: University of Maryland Global COVID-19 Trends and Impact Survey (UMD-CTIS), in partnership with Facebook; updated 03/2022).
blurb.rep_covid_rate_blurb: COVID-19 case and death rates per 100 000 population disaggregated by age and sex, weekly since April 2020. (Original data source: WHO COVID-19 Detailed Surveillance Data Dashboard; updated 03/2023).
blurb.rep_covid_cfr_blurb: COVID-19 case fatality ratios disaggregated by age and sex, weekly since April 2020. (Original data source: WHO COVID-19 Detailed Surveillance Data Dashboard; updated 03/2023).
blurb.rep_rmnch_blurb: Reproductive, maternal, newborn, child health indicators from household surveys disaggregated by age, economic status, education, place of residence, sex and subnational region. (Original data sources: Re-analysis of Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS), Multiple Indicator Cluster Surveys (MICS) and Reproductive Health Surveys (RHS) by the WHO Collaborating Center for Health Equity Monitoring (International Center for Equity in Health, Federal University of Pelotas); The DHS Program; and the UNICEF Data Warehouse; updated 02/2023).
blurb.rep_gho_rmnch_blurb: Reproductive, maternal, newborn and child health indicators from WHO estimates disaggregated by age and sex. (Original data source: WHO Global Health Observatory (GHO); updated 03/2023).
blurb.rep_nut_blurb: Child malnutrition estimates disaggregated by age, economic status, education, place of residence, sex and subnational region. (Original data source: UNICEF-WHO-World Bank Joint Child Malnutrition Estimates; updated 06/2022).
blurb.rep_igme_u5mr_blurb: Under-five mortality rates disaggregated by economic status and sex. (Original data source: United Nations Inter-agency Group for Child Mortality Estimation (UN IGME); updated 03/2023).
blurb.rep_igme_u5mr_admin1_blurb: Under-five mortality rates disaggregated by subnational region, at the first administrative level. (Original data source: United Nations Inter-agency Group for Child Mortality Estimation (UN IGME); updated 09/2022).
blurb.rep_igme_u5mr_admin2_blurb: Under-five mortality rates disaggregated by subnational region, at the second administrative level. (Original data source: United Nations Inter-agency Group for Child Mortality Estimation (UN IGME); updated 09/2022).
blurb.rep_ihme_anaemia_blurb: Anaemia prevalence geospatial estimates in women of reproductive age disaggregated by subnational region. (Original data source: Institute for Health Metrics and Evaluation (IHME) estimates; updated 09/2022).
blurb.rep_ihme_bf_blurb: Exclusive breastfeeding prevalence geospatial estimates among infants under six months of age disaggregated by subnational region. (Original data source: Institute for Health Metrics and Evaluation (IHME) estimates; updated 09/2022).
blurb.rep_ihme_diarr_blurb: Diarrhoea prevalence, incidence and mortality geospatial estimates among children aged under five years disaggregated by subnational region. (Original data source: Institute for Health Metrics and Evaluation (IHME) estimates; updated 09/2022).
blurb.rep_imm_blurb: Childhood immunization indicators disaggregated by age, economic status, education, place of residence, sex and subnational region. (Original data sources: Re-analysis of Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS), Multiple Indicator Cluster Surveys (MICS), and Reproductive Health Surveys (RHS) by the WHO Collaborating Center for Health Equity Monitoring (International Center for Equity in Health, Federal University of Pelotas); updated 06/2022).
blurb.rep_dtp_sub_blurb: DTP1-DTP3 immunization dropout rates disaggregated by district quintiles. (Original data source: Administrative data shared with WHO/UNICEF through the Joint Reporting Form process in 2017 and 2018; updated 03/2021).
blurb.rep_unaids_hiv_blurb: HIV indicators related to new infections, deaths and treatment disaggregated by age and sex. (Original data source: UNAIDS/UNICEF/WHO estimates; updated 03/2023).
blurb.rep_dhs_unicef_hiv_blurb: Indicators related to HIV/AIDS knowledge, attitudes, practices and testing disaggregated by age, economic status, education, employment status, marital status, place of residence, sex and subnational region. (Original data sources: Demographic and Health Survey (DHS) Program and UNICEF Data Warehouse; updated 12/2022).
blurb.rep_ihme_ssa_hiv_blurb: HIV incidence and mortality geospatial estimates in sub-Saharan Africa disaggregated by subnational region. (Original data source: Institute for Health Metrics and Evaluation (IHME) estimates; updated 09/2022).
blurb.rep_tb_blurb: Tuberculosis indicators related to burden, prevention, knowledge and attitudes, and social protection, disaggregated by age, economic status, education, place of residence, sex and TB drug resistance status, presented in the WHO 'State of inequality: HIV, tuberculosis and malaria' report. (Original data sources: Country reported estimates, Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS), Multiple Indicator Cluster Surveys (MICS), Reproductive Health Surveys (RHS), TB patient cost surveys, TB prevalence surveys, and WHO estimates; updated 06/12/2021).
blurb.rep_dhs_unicef_malaria_blurb: Indicators related to malaria burden, prevention, and testing and treatment, disaggregated by age, economic status, education, place of residence, sex and subnational region. (Original data sources: Demographic and Health Survey (DHS) Program and UNICEF Data Warehouse; updated 12/2022).
blurb.rep_ihme_malaria_blurb: Malaria prevalence, incidence and mortality geospatial estimates disaggregated by subnational region. (Original data source: Institute for Health Metrics and Evaluation (IHME) estimates; updated 09/2022).
blurb.rep_dhs_ahn_blurb: Indicators related to adult health and nutrition disaggregated by age, economic status, education, marital status, place of residence and subnational region. (Original data source: Demographic and Health Survey (DHS) Program; updated 02/2023).
blurb.rep_gho_alcohol_blurb: Indicators related to alcohol consumption disaggregated by sex. (Original data source: WHO Global Health Observatory (GHO); updated 03/2023).
blurb.rep_gho_tobacco_blurb: Indicators related to tobacco use disaggregated by sex. (Original data source: WHO Global Health Observatory (GHO); updated 03/2023).
blurb.rep_gho_ncd_blurb: Indicators related to noncommunicable diseases and risk factors (including alcohol consumption, insufficient physical activity, nutrition, raised blood pressure, raised blood glucose, tobacco use) disaggregated by sex. (Original data source: WHO Global Health Observatory (GHO); updated 03/2023).
blurb.rep_eurostat_ah_blurb: Indicators related to health status and health behaviours and risk factors (including alcohol, physical activity, nutrition, blood pressure, blood glucose, tobacco use) disaggregated by age, economic status, education, place of residence and sex. (Original data source: Eurostat, the statistical office of the European Union; updated 07/2023).
blurb.rep_oecd_ah_blurb: Indicators related to self-reported health status in OECD countries, disaggregated by age, economic status, education and sex. (Original data source: Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development, HEALTH_STAT dataset; updated 07/2023).
blurb.rep_dhs_hca_blurb: Indicators related to health care access disaggregated by age, economic status, education, employment status, marital status, number of living children, place of residence and subnational region. (Original data source: Demographic and Health Survey (DHS) Program; updated 02/2023).
blurb.rep_gho_hc_blurb: Indicators related to the health care system and health care access disaggregated by age, economic status, place of residence and sex. (Original data source: WHO Global Health Observatory (GHO); updated 03/2023).
blurb.rep_eurostat_hc_blurb: Indicators related to health care disaggregated by age, economic status, education, place of residence and sex. (Original data source: Eurostat, the statistical office of the European Union; updated 07/2023).
blurb.rep_oecd_hc_blurb: Indicators related to health care quality, resources and expenditure in OECD countries, disaggregated by age and sex. (Original data source: Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development, EBDAG / HEALTH_REAC / HEALTH_HCQI datasets; updated 07/2023).
blurb.rep_ghe_death_sex_blurb: Disease mortality rates per 100 000 population disaggregated by sex. (Original data source: WHO Global Health Estimates (GHE); updated 08/2022).
blurb.rep_ghe_daly_sex_blurb: Disability-adjusted life years (DALYs) per 100 000 population disaggregated by sex. (Original data source: WHO Global Health Estimates (GHE); updated 08/2022).
blurb.rep_ghe_yld_sex_blurb: Years of healthy life lost due to disability (YLD) per 100 000 population disaggregated by sex. (Original data source: WHO Global Health Estimates (GHE); updated 08/2022).
blurb.rep_ghe_yll_sex_blurb: Years of life lost from mortality (YLL) per 100 000 population disaggregated by sex. (Original data source: WHO Global Health Estimates (GHE); updated 08/2022).
blurb.rep_ghe_death_age_blurb: Disease mortality rates per 100 000 population disaggregated by age. (Original data source: WHO Global Health Estimates (GHE); updated 08/2022).
blurb.rep_ghe_daly_age_blurb: Disability-adjusted life years (DALYs) per 100 000 population disaggregated by age. (Original data source: WHO Global Health Estimates (GHE); updated 08/2022).
blurb.rep_ghe_yld_age_blurb: Years of healthy life lost due to disability (YLD) per 100 000 population disaggregated by age. (Original data source: WHO Global Health Estimates (GHE); updated 08/2022).
blurb.rep_ghe_yll_age_blurb: Years of life lost from mortality (YLL) per 100 000 population disaggregated by age. (Original data source: WHO Global Health Estimates (GHE); updated 08/2022).
blurb.rep_gho_mortality_blurb: Life expectancy and mortality rates disaggregated by sex. (Original data source: WHO Global Health Observatory (GHO); updated 03/2023).
blurb.rep_ihme_inc_blurb: Disease incidence estimates disaggregated by sex. (Original data source: Institute for Health Metrics and Evaluation (IHME) Global Burden of Disease study 2019; updated 09/2022).
blurb.rep_ihme_prev_blurb: Disease prevalence estimates disaggregated by sex. (Original data source: Institute for Health Metrics and Evaluation (IHME) Global Burden of Disease study 2019; updated 09/2022).
blurb.rep_eurostat_disab1_blurb: Indicators related to health status, health behaviours and risk factors, health care and health determinants in European countries disaggregated by disability. (Original data source: Eurostat, the statistical office of the European Union; updated 07/2023).
blurb.rep_eurostat_disab2_blurb: Indicators related to health status, health behaviours and risk factors, health care and health determinants among people with disability in European countries, disaggregated by age and sex. (Original data source: Eurostat, the statistical office of the European Union; updated 07/2023).
blurb.rep_eurostat_mig1_blurb: Indicators related to health status, health behaviours and risk factors, health care and health determinants in European countries disaggregated by migratory status. (Original data source: Eurostat, the statistical office of the European Union; updated 07/2023).
blurb.rep_eurostat_mig2_blurb: Indicators related to health status, health behaviours and risk factors, health care and health determinants among people who are migrants in European countries, disaggregated by age, sex and type of migrant. (Original data source: Eurostat, the statistical office of the European Union; updated 07/2023).
blurb.rep_unsd_unhcr_mig_blurb: The number of international migrants and refugees per 1000 population, disaggregated by age, urban/rural place of residence and sex. (Original data source: United Nations Statistical Department (UNSD) International Migrant Stock 2020 and UN Refugee Agency (UNHCR) Refugee Population Statistics Database; updated 07/2023).
blurb.rep_wash_blurb: Access to drinking water, sanitation and hygiene (WASH) within households, schools and health care facilities disaggregated by place of residence. (Original data source: WHO/UNICEF Joint Monitoring Programme for Water Supply, Sanitation and Hygiene (JMP); updated 03/2023).
blurb.rep_gpw13_blurb: Indicators used within the impact measurement of WHO’s Thirteenth General Programme of Work (GPW 13), WHO’s strategy for the period 2019-2025, disaggregated by age, economic status, education, place of residence, sex and subnational region. (Original data sources: Re-analysis of Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS), Multiple Indicator Cluster Surveys (MICS), and Reproductive Health Surveys (RHS); WHO Global Health Estimates; WHO Global Health Observatory (GHO); WHO/UNICEF Joint Monitoring Programme for Water Supply, Sanitation and Hygiene (JMP); UNICEF/WHO/World Bank Joint Malnutrition Estimates; UNAIDS/UNICEF/WHO HIV incidence estimates; updated 03/2023).
blurb.rep_wb_blurb: Indicators related to health determinants (e.g. education, employment and environment) disaggregated by economic status, place of residence and sex. (Original data source: The World Bank Data Catalog; updated 02/2023).
blurb.rep_dhs_unicef_sdh_blurb: Indicators related to health determinants (e.g. education, communication, employment and household characteristics) disaggregated by age, economic status, education, employment type, marital status, number of living children, place of residence, sex and subnational region. (Original data sources: Demographic and Health Survey (DHS) Program and UNICEF Data Warehouse; updated 12/2022).
blurb.rep_gho_env_blurb: Indicators related to environmental health (including water and sanitation, air pollution, cooking fuel) disaggregated by place of residence and sex. (Original data source: WHO Global Health Observatory (GHO); updated 03/2023).
blurb.rep_swper_blurb: Survey-based women’s empowerment index (SWPER) indicators covering three index domains (social independence, decision-making, and attitude to violence), disaggregated by economic status, education, place of residence and subnational region. (Original data source: Re-analysis of Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) by the WHO Collaborating Center for Health Equity Monitoring (International Center for Equity in Health, Federal University of Pelotas); updated 06/2022).
blurb.rep_gdl1_blurb: Development indices (Human Development Index, Gender Development Index, International Wealth Index, Gini coefficient and Theil-T) disaggregated by economic status, place of residence, poverty status and subnational region. (Original data source: Global Data Lab; updated 01/2023).
blurb.rep_gdl2_blurb: Indicators used to create development indices (Human Development Index, Gender Development Index, International Wealth Index, Gini coefficient and Theil-T) disaggregated by economic status, place of residence, poverty status and subnational region. (Original data source: Global Data Lab; updated 01/2023).
blurb.rep_mpi_blurb: Multidimensional Poverty Index (MPI) disaggregated by ethnicity/race/caste (Original data source: United Nations Development Programme (UNDP) 2021; updated 10/2022) and disaggregated by age, place of residence, sex of household head and subnational region. (Original data source: Oxford Poverty and Human Development Initiative (OPHI) 2022; updated 10/2022).
blurb.rep_dhs_unicef_cpr_blurb: Indicators related to child protection and female genital mutilation (FGM) disaggregated by age, economic status, education, employment status, marital status, number of living children, place of residence, religion, sex and subnational region. (Original data sources: Demographic and Health Survey (DHS) Program and UNICEF Data Warehouse; updated 12/2022).
blurb.rep_eurostat_sdh_blurb: Indicators related to health determinants (housing conditions, income distribution, poverty and material deprivation) in European countries disaggregated by age, economic status, education, place of residence and sex. (Original data source: Eurostat, the statistical office of the European Union; updated 07/2023).
blurb.rep_oecd_sdh_blurb: Indicators related to the determinants of health and well-being in OECD countries, disaggregated by age, education and sex. (Original data source: Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development, 'How's Life? Well-Being' dataset; updated 07/2023).

dataset_name.rep_ctis3_dataset: COVID-19 burden, behaviours and testing (Global COVID-19 Trends and Impact Survey)
dataset_name.rep_ctis2_dataset: COVID-19 vaccination (Global COVID-19 Trends and Impact Survey)
dataset_name.rep_ctis1_dataset: COVID-19 related mental health and financial worry (Global COVID-19 Trends and Impact Survey)
dataset_name.rep_covid_rate_dataset: COVID-19 cases and deaths (WHO COVID-19 surveillance data)
dataset_name.rep_covid_cfr_dataset: COVID-19 case fatality ratios (WHO COVID-19 surveillance data)
dataset_name.rep_rmnch_dataset: Reproductive, maternal, newborn and child health (household surveys)
dataset_name.rep_gho_rmnch_dataset: Reproductive, maternal, newborn and child health (WHO Global Health Observatory)
dataset_name.rep_igme_u5mr_admin1_dataset: Subnational under-five mortality - first administrative level (UN IGME)
dataset_name.rep_igme_u5mr_admin2_dataset: Subnational under-five mortality - second administrative level (UN IGME)
dataset_name.rep_ihme_diarr_dataset: Subnational diarrhoea prevalence, incidence and mortality geospatial estimates (IHME)
dataset_name.rep_dhs_unicef_hiv_dataset: HIV/AIDS (DHS Program and UNICEF Data Warehouse)
dataset_name.rep_ihme_ssa_hiv_dataset: Sub-Saharan Africa subnational HIV incidence and mortality geospatial estimates (IHME)
dataset_name.rep_dhs_unicef_malaria_dataset: Malaria (DHS Program and UNICEF Data Warehouse)
dataset_name.rep_ihme_malaria_dataset: Subnational malaria prevalence, incidence and mortality geospatial estimates (IHME)
dataset_name.rep_gho_ncd_dataset: Noncommunicable diseases and risk factors (WHO Global Health Observatory)
dataset_name.rep_gho_hc_dataset: Health care system and access (WHO Global Health Observatory)
dataset_name.rep_oecd_hc_dataset: Health care quality, resources and expenditure (OECD)
dataset_name.rep_ghe_death_sex_dataset: Mortality rates by sex (WHO Global Health Estimates)
dataset_name.rep_ghe_daly_sex_dataset: Disability-adjusted life years by sex (WHO Global Health Estimates)
dataset_name.rep_ghe_yld_sex_dataset: Years of healthy life lost due to disability by sex (WHO Global Health Estimates)
dataset_name.rep_ghe_yll_sex_dataset: Years of life lost from mortality by sex (WHO Global Health Estimates)
dataset_name.rep_ghe_death_age_dataset: Mortality rates by age (WHO Global Health Estimates)
dataset_name.rep_ghe_daly_age_dataset: Disability-adjusted life years by age (WHO Global Health Estimates)
dataset_name.rep_ghe_yld_age_dataset: Years of healthy life lost due to disability by age (WHO Global Health Estimates)
dataset_name.rep_ghe_yll_age_dataset: Years of life lost from mortality by age (WHO Global Health Estimates)
dataset_name.rep_gho_mortality_dataset: Life expectancy and mortality (WHO Global Health Observatory)
dataset_name.rep_ihme_inc_dataset: Disease incidence estimates (IHME Global Burden of Disease study)
dataset_name.rep_ihme_prev_dataset: Disease prevalence estimates (IHME Global Burden of Disease study)
dataset_name.rep_eurostat_mig2_dataset: Indicators among people who are migrants (Eurostat)
dataset_name.rep_gpw13_dataset: WHO 13th General Programme of Work (multiple data sources)
dataset_name.rep_dhs_unicef_cpr_dataset: Child protection (DHS Program and UNICEF Data Warehouse)
dataset_name.rep_dhs_unicef_sdh_dataset: Health determinants (DHS Program and UNICEF Data Warehouse)
dataset_name.rep_swper_dataset: Women's empowerment index (SWPER) (DHS re-analyzed by ICEH)

text.disclaimer: Please note that some datasets listed here are from externally published sources and are therefore not WHO official estimates. Please refer to the Indicator Metadata in the About menu for more information.
text.terms1: By clicking OK, you are accepting the
text.terms2: Terms of Use and Software License Agreement

labels.heatplus: Health Equity Assessment Toolkit Plus (HEAT Plus)
labels.determinants_tooltip: Determinants are only shown for datasets with annual data

text.calculations: Difference and ratio measures are calculated for dimensions with 30 subgroups or more. If estimates are not available, then summary measures cannot be calculated.

indicators.mdbu: Mean difference from best performing subgroup (unweighted) (MDBU)
indicators.mdbw: Mean difference from best performing subgreoup (weighted) (MDBW)

indicators_nodisply.asfr1: Adolescent fertility rate (births per 1000 women aged 15-19 years)
